history.content: I think this is a good schedule, considering the time you have left and your desire to declare CS.

children.subject:
Thanks for your response! Econ is my backup major in case i don't get into CS (i have all the prereqs for Econ complete besides for Stat 20). 

Did you feel like taking Math 54 and EE16A at the same time helped or created more confusion? just curious cause I heard they overlap a little bit in material

Ah okay... Your grade in 61A is going to mean a lot for declaring and if I were you I would consider delaying either EE16A or Math 54 since you will have time to take these courses if you declare. I came from Econ as well, the summer going into my junior year, and the workload increase caught me off guard at first. I also finished all of the CS requirements on time and only have to take two courses next semester, so I could have taken EE16A or something now instead of then. If you have no former prior programming experience, I would definitely consider delaying any of the other classes besides 61A. Also, consider 61B over summer. That way you can split up the 3 GPA courses and can focus mainly on them.

As for taking them at the same time, I felt like it didn't hurt or help. Honestly, the linear used in 16A is not very hard and I found the first part of 54 to be a lot easier than I thought, especially compared to the second part D.E. Sorry I can't be more helpful with that!

Thanks for your response, it is very helpful! I think I will delay 16A then and just take CS61A, Math 54, and Stat 20. Math 54 is being taught by a really good professor next semester, so hopefully it's not too bad!

Do I have to be at UC Berkeley to take 61B over summer?
Yes, it's a lab-based class (3 hours of lab a day, 4 days a week).

Depends on what major you come from and the workload that was expected then. I took 61B, 54, and 16A together and it was not too bad, with most of my time spent towards 61B. Not sure why you are taking Stat 20 though

history.content: Do not take Math 54 and EE 16A. Just take EE 16A and then EE16B.
Math 54, Stat 20, CS 61A, EE16A. Is this too difficult? I'm a second semester sophomore who has very recently decided to change majors and try to declare CS.
history.subject: thoughts on my schedule?
